messages.title: Working for the Vale of Clwyd
messages.content: Mair Rowlands has been chosen as Plaid Cymru's candidate for the Vale of Clwyd in the 2015 UK General Election. Mair, who is 26, is a county councillor and Cabinet Member for Children and Young People and Leisure in Gwynedd. 'I am honoured to have been chosen to stand for Plaid Cymru in the Vale of Clwyd at the next Westminster election. I am fully committed to improving the Vale of Clwyd’s economy and its future prosperity.'

mentions.tacticalSituation: The only reason that Scotland is getting more attention and resources than Wales is because people there are voting SNP. The people can learn at Westminster by voting Plaid Cymru at the next General Election.

issues.economy: We need more help for low and middle income families and those looking for work in the Vale, especially our young people. I want to see more high quality jobs that pay a fair wage.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am honoured to have been chosen to stand for Plaid Cymru in the Vale of Clwyd at the next Westminster election. I am fully committed to improving the Vale of Clwyd’s economy and its future prosperity.

politicalExperience.role: County Councillor and Cabinet Member for Children and Young People and Leisure in Gwynedd

endorsements.endorser: Llyr Gruffydd, Plaid Cymru AM for the region
endorsements.endorsement: We are delighted to have such an outstanding young candidate standing for Plaid Cymru. Mair has already built up a track record of work and achievement in the community and would make a superb MP.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Promoted by Dafydd Timothy on behalf of Mair Rowlands, both c/o Eleri Edwards, Pen y Cefn, Ffordd Denbigh, Rhyl, LL18 2LS.
